de.polygonal.ds.IntHashSet

type
class
implements
Set<Int>

An array hash set for storing integers.

Amortized running time in Big O notation

Static Variables

VAL_ABSENT(inline,null) : Int

Return code for a non-existing element.

Constructor

new(slotCount : Int, ?capacity : Int, ?isResizable : Bool, ?maxSize : Int)

parameters
slotCount the total number of slots into which the hashed elements are distributed. This defines the space-time trade off of the set. Increasing the slotCount reduces the computation time (read/write/access) of the set at the cost of increased memory use. This value is fixed and can only be changed by calling rehash(), which rebuilds the set (expensive).
capacity the initial physical space for storing the elements at the time the set is created. This is also the minimum allowed size of the set and cannot be changed in the future. If omitted, the initial capacity equals slotCount. The capacity is automatically adjusted according to the storage requirements based on two rules:
  1. If the set runs out of space, the capacity is doubled (if isResizable is true).
  2. If the size() falls below a quarter of the current capacity, the capacity is cut in half while the minimum capacity can't fall below capacity.
isResizable if false, the hash set is created with a fixed size. Thus adding an element when size() equals capacity throws an error. Otherwise the capacity is automatically adjusted. Default is true.
maxSize the maximum allowed size of this hash set. The default value of -1 indicates that there is no upper limit.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError slotCount is not a power of two (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError capacity is not a power of two (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError capacity is < 2 (debug only).

Instance Variables

key : Int

A unique identifier for this object.
A hash table transforms this key into an index of an array element by using a hash function.
This value should never be changed by the user.

maxSize : Int

The maximum allowed size of this hash set.
Once the maximum size is reached, adding an element will fail with an error (debug only).
A value of -1 indicates that the size is unbound.
Always equals -1 in release mode.

reuseIterator : Bool

If true, reuses the iterator object instead of allocating a new one when calling iterator().
The default is false.
If true, nested iterations are likely to fail as only one iteration is allowed at a time.

Instance Methods

clear(?purge : Bool) : Void

parameters
purge If true, the hash set shrinks to the initial capacity defined in the constructor.
Removes all elements.
n

clone(?assign : Bool, ?copier : Int -> Int) : Collection<Int>

Duplicates this hash set by creating a deep copy.
The assign and copier parameters are ignored.

inline contains(x : Int) : Bool

Same as has(). 1

free() : Void

Destroys this object by explicitly nullifying all elements.
Improves GC efficiency/performance (optional). n

inline getCapacity() : Int

The size of the allocated storage space for the elements.
If more space is required to accomodate new elements, the capacity is doubled every time size() grows beyond capacity, and split in half when size() is a quarter of capacity. The capacity never falls below the initial size defined in the constructor.

getCollisionCount() : Int

Counts the total number of collisions.
A collision occurs when two distinct elements are hashed into the same slot. n

inline getLoadFactor() : Float

The load factor measure the "denseness" of a hash set and is proportional to the time cost to look up an entry.
E.g. assuming that the elements are perfectly distributed, a load factor of 4.0 indicates that each slot stores 4 elements, which have to be sequentially searched in order to find an element.
A high load factor thus indicates poor performance. If the load factor gets too high, additional slots can be allocated by calling rehash().

inline getSlotCount() : Int

The total number of allocated slots.

inline has(x : Int) : Bool

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError value 0x80000000 is reserved (debug only).
Returns true if this set contains the element x. 1

inline hasFront(x : Int) : Bool

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError value 0x80000000 is reserved (debug only).
Returns true if this set contains the element x.
Uses move-to-front-on-access which reduces access time when similar elements are frequently queried. 1

inline isEmpty() : Bool

Returns true if the set is empty. 1

iterator() : Itr<Int>

see
http://haxe.org/ref/iterators
Returns a new IntHashSetIterator object to iterate over all elements contained in this hash set.
The elements are visited in a random order.

rehash(slotCount : Int) : Void

throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError slotCount is not a power of two (debug only).
Redistributes all elements over slotCount.
This is an expensive operations as the set is rebuild from scratch. n

inline remove(x : Int) : Bool

returns
true if x was successfully removed, false if x does not exist.
Removes the element x. 1

inline set(x : Int) : Bool

returns
true if x was added to this set, false if x already exists.
throws
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError value 0x80000000 is reserved (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError size() equals maxSize (debug only).
de.polygonal.core.util.AssertError hash set is full (if not resizable).
Adds the element x to this set if possible. 1

inline size() : Int

The total number of elements. 1

toArray() : Array<Int>

Returns an unordered array containing all elements in this set.

toDA() : DA<Int>

Returns an unordered dense array containing all elements in this set.

toString() : String

Returns a string representing the current object.
Example:
	  var set = new de.polygonal.ds.IntHashSet(16);
	  for (i in 0...4) {
	      set.set(i);
	  }
	  trace(set);
	  {IntHashSet, size/capacity: 4/16, load factor: 0.25 }
	  |<
	    0
	    1
	    2
	    3
	  >|

toVector() : flash.Vector<Dynamic>

Returns an unordered Vector.<T> object containing all elements in this set.
